properties.name: margin-top
properties.appliesTo: all elements except internal table elements, ruby base containers, and ruby annotation containers
properties.percentages: refer to logical width of containing block
properties.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

properties.name: margin-right
properties.appliesTo: all elements except internal table elements, ruby base containers, and ruby annotation containers
properties.percentages: refer to logical width of containing block
properties.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

properties.name: margin-bottom
properties.appliesTo: all elements except internal table elements, ruby base containers, and ruby annotation containers
properties.percentages: refer to logical width of containing block
properties.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

properties.name: margin-left
properties.appliesTo: all elements except internal table elements, ruby base containers, and ruby annotation containers
properties.percentages: refer to logical width of containing block
properties.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

properties.name: margin
properties.appliesTo: all elements except internal table elements, ruby base containers, and ruby annotation containers
properties.percentages: refer to logical width of containing block

properties.name: margin-trim
properties.value: none | [ block || inline ] | [ block-start || inline-start || block-end || inline-end ]
properties.appliesTo: block containers, multi-column containers, flex containers, grid containers
properties.computedValue: a set of zero to four keywords indicating which sides to trim

values.name: none
values.prose: Margins are not trimmed by the container.

values.name: block-start
values.prose: For in-flow boxes contained by this box, margins adjacent to the box’s specified edges are truncated to zero. It also truncates any descendant margins collapsed with such a margin (but not its own, its siblings’, or its ancestors’).

values.name: block-end
values.prose: For in-flow boxes contained by this box, margins adjacent to the box’s specified edges are truncated to zero. It also truncates any descendant margins collapsed with such a margin (but not its own, its siblings’, or its ancestors’).

values.name: inline-start
values.prose: Computes to block-start block-end.

values.name: inline-end
values.prose: Computes to block-start block-end.

values.name: block
values.prose: Computes to block-start block-end.

values.name: inline
values.prose: Computes to inline-start inline-end.

properties.name: padding
properties.appliesTo: all elements except: internal table elements other than table cells, ruby base containers, and ruby annotation containers
properties.percentages: refer to logical width of containing block

values.name: <box>
values.prose: The following <box> CSS keywords are defined for use in properties (such as transform-box and background-clip) that need to refer to various box edges:

values.name: content-box
values.prose: Refers to the content box or content edge. (In an SVG context, treated as fill-box.)

values.name: padding-box
values.prose: Refers to the padding box or padding edge. (In an SVG context, treated as fill-box.)

values.name: border-box
values.prose: Refers to the border box or border edge. (In an SVG context, treated as stroke-box.)

values.name: margin-box
values.prose: Refers to the margin box or margin edge. (In an SVG context, treated as stroke-box.)

values.name: fill-box
values.prose: Refers to the object bounding box or its edges. (In a CSS box context, treated as content-box.)

values.name: stroke-box
values.prose: Refers to the stroke bounding box or its edges. (In a CSS box context, treated as border-box.)

values.name: view-box
values.prose: Refers to the nearest SVG viewport’s origin box, which is a rectangle with the width and height of the SVG viewport, positioned such that its top left corner is anchored at the coordinate system origin. (In a CSS box context, treated as border-box.)

values.name: content-box
values.prose: Refers to the content box or content edge. (In an SVG context, treated as fill-box.)

values.name: padding-box
values.prose: Refers to the padding box or padding edge. (In an SVG context, treated as fill-box.)

values.name: border-box
values.prose: Refers to the border box or border edge. (In an SVG context, treated as stroke-box.)

values.name: margin-box
values.prose: Refers to the margin box or margin edge. (In an SVG context, treated as stroke-box.)

values.name: fill-box
values.prose: Refers to the object bounding box or its edges. (In a CSS box context, treated as content-box.)

values.name: stroke-box
values.prose: Refers to the stroke bounding box or its edges. (In a CSS box context, treated as border-box.)

values.name: view-box
values.prose: Refers to the nearest SVG viewport’s origin box, which is a rectangle with the width and height of the SVG viewport, positioned such that its top left corner is anchored at the coordinate system origin. (In a CSS box context, treated as border-box.)
